title: Back of the Thigh, Popliteal Fossa

questions.question: 1. Which muscle forms the superior lateral boundary of the popliteal fossa?
2. Which muscle primarily contributes to the medial border of the popliteal fossa?
3. Which muscle forms the primary muscular floor of the popliteal fossa?
4. What structures together form the roof of the popliteal fossa?
options: Skin, subcutaneous tissue, and popliteal (deep) fascia

questions.question: 5. Which vessel is the direct continuation of the femoral artery as it enters the popliteal fossa?
6. Which nerve divides into the tibial and common fibular (peroneal) nerves just proximal to the popliteal fossa?
7. Within the popliteal fossa, which structure is typically found most laterally?
8. Which structure is located most medially within the popliteal fossa?
9. Which major posterior thigh muscle contributes to hip extension and forms part of the lateral boundary of the popliteal fossa?
10. Which of the following structures is NOT normally found within the popliteal fossa?
11. During surgical procedures in the popliteal fossa, which structure is most at risk due to its deep location?
12. Which nerve provides the sensory innervation to the skin of the posterior thigh and popliteal region?
options: Posterior cutaneous nerve of the thigh

questions.question: 13. Which of the following muscles is NOT considered part of the hamstring group?
14. The popliteal fossa is best described as a diamond-shaped space located at the posterior aspect of which joint?
15. Which of the following serves as an important landmark when deep dissecting the popliteal fossa?
options: The lateral head of the gastrocnemius muscle
